* Sebastien Lambla <seb@...> [2008-07-07 11:45]:
> My issue would be with special casing any status code, it
> obfuscate them quite a bit.

That was just a case of word choice on my part. What about “201
with Location and an empty entity” seems ambiguous to you? What
other way could this reasonably be interpreted than “look over
there if you want to see the result of your request”? How is
this obsure?

> That said, why do you simply not return the newly created
> entity as the entity body of your 201 when html has been
> conneged?

Because then the address bar would show the container’s URI
instead of the created resource’s. And I’d have to include a
Content-Location anyway which is broken in browsers and good
luck with fixing *that*. (Thanks, Microsoft.)

Regards,
-- 
Aristotle Pagaltzis // <http://plasmasturm.org/>
